metadata.Title: CVE-2022-4283 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: A vulnerability was found in X.Org. This security flaw occurs because the XkbCopyNames function left a dangling pointer to freed memory, resulting in out-of-bounds memory access on subsequent XkbGetKbdByName requests.. This issue can lead to local privileges elevation on systems where the X server is running privileged and remote code execution for ssh X forwarding sessions.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> xorg server is actually the xorg-server package the xorg package only contains docs xwayland package contains parts of xorg-server This is ZDI-CAN-19530

criterions.comment: xorg-server: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
